education.program: Master of Fine Arts - Music Composition for the Screen

select_rehabilitation.title: Application Engineer
responsibilities: Designed and implemented extensible Docker-based Python CLI ETL utility to migrate data from MS-SQL Server to Postgres with optional intermediate transformations
Designed and implemented pre-commit hook components for Pentaho Kettle transformation files to enable standardized deployment across projects and eliminate regressions
Separated master config into discrete JSON config files per table to allow utility to run with arbitrary tables, reducing debugging time and improving developer experience
Developed and maintained event-driven job workflows using Job Scheduler 7 for orchestration
Implemented standardized tooling setup script to automate Python environment setup for new projects, reducing time needed to spin up a new project and ensuring consistency
Performed analysis on data quality issues (missing data, inaccurate data) to ensure accuracy for therapists, reporting analysts and patients
Integrated new facility data sources into daily ETL workflow with minimal downtime for users by developing and testing processes in parallel with current production workflow
Modeled and implemented new views and ETL integrations to uphold compliance requirements for payroll based journaling (PBJ)
Optimized current warehouse views to remove unnecessary joins and improve performance
Designing and implementing integration test suite using Pytest for testing PostgreSQL to PostgreSQL transfers and automating data quality checks

jll_technologies.title: Data Engineer I
responsibilities: Contributed to ongoing redesign and implementation of PySpark ETL framework using Azure
Scheduled ETL jobs to write to SQL marts/Delta Lake with minimal interruptions for users
Contributed to unit/integration test suites to ensure confidence in new features and reduce regressions
Performed ingestion project to migrate orphaned data from local data warehouse to central data lake
Standardized setup and deployment documentation to enhance team efficiency
Collaborated with other teams to migrate from one-off ETL scripts to a config-driven framework
Spearheaded initiative to identify and publish a directory of internal subject matter experts to aid ingestion work

pathfinder_docker_server.description: Developed a solution to host an instance of Foundry Virtual Tabletop (VTT) software in Docker container hosted locally on a Raspberry Pi 4 using secure tunnel through Cloudflare

bike_share_data_pipeline.description: Originally intended only to be a project to practice data engineering from scratch without following a tutorial, this project is a data pipeline to retrieve, process and publish data from Chicago's Divvy Bike Share open data repository into an interactive application to promote bicycle usage
responsibilities: Developed Puppeteer web crawler to scrape CSV files from Divvy's AWS S3 bucket and download them to a local directory
Implemented ingestion/transformation workflow to enrich and load data to PostgreSQL development database hosted in Docker
Wrote an async rate-limited request utility to make 380k+ requests to Mapbox's Directions API to enrich Divvy station data with turn by turn directions and distance measurements
Writing data application with Streamlit to allow users to explore relevant data by including fine-grained controls for date and time selection
Wrote copy for the application illustrating environmental impacts of current levels of bike share adoption on carbon emissions, physical space saved by taking a bike vs. motor vehicle
Currently writing sections to demonstrate average financial savings of adopting mass transit and bicycles vs. motor vehicles
Future plans include writing modules to demonstrate average health outcomes of bicycle adoption vs motor vehicles, outline current obstacles to increased adoption of alternative transit modalities

Additional plans include ability for users of the app to contact their own local elected representatives to advocate for safer, more sustainable transit investments via newsletter and letter writing campaigns
